title: Font that's similar to Park Avenue
content:
Can anyone tell me what font this is? It's very similar to Park Avenue, but the letters are joined and the r extends all the way to the baseline.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [word.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150128045832/http:/typophile.com/files/word_0.jpg) | 339.31 KB |
author: Susiequs

comments.content:
It appears to be a variation of [Park Avenue](http://web.archive.org/web/20150128045832/http:/new.myfonts.com/search/park+avenue/fonts/?testdrive=custom%3D0%26seed%3D26%26dock%3D0%26size%3D72%26w%3D600%26src%3Dcustom%26text%3DPrimarily%26fg%3D000000%26bg%3Dffffff%26goodies%3Dot.liga) with alterations to "r" and "y".

After more research it appears a little closer to [Park Place](http://web.archive.org/web/20150128045832/http:/www.webpagepublicity.com/free-fonts-p.html) which has softer curves on the "y".

I know that it looks like Park Avenue, However the letters are joined together and the lowercase r is extended all the way to the baseline on the left hand side. I didn't know if there was another font that looked like Park Avenue but had these attributes.
Are you sure it's a font? It could just be a custom job.
